comments:
Build ID: I20070323-1616

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Open the update dialog and look for a feature (i.e. polarion Subversive SVN client)
2. Now check a feature (at random) to install
3. Get the NPE :(

(Note that the NPE won't stop me from installing what I want: but it is an annoying message box which is displayed anytime I check a feature to install ...)

More information:
The stacktrace follows:

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage$TreeContentProvider.getParent(ReviewPage.java:185)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage.getSite(ReviewPage.java:1398)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage.access$29(ReviewPage.java:1395)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.ReviewPage$14.run(ReviewPage.java:837)
at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

My system details are:

eclipse.buildId=I20070323-1616
java.version=1.6.0
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86_64, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -startup /home/mario/apps/eclipse-3.3/plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.v20070319.jar
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86_64 -startup /home/mario/apps/eclipse-3.3/plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.v20070319.jar -clean

This happens with any feature (even the ones from the Europa updates!) and even with clean eclipse installations.
Please try with a newer I build and let me know if it is still an issue - I think this problem has been fixed in M6+ builds.
Right. Works ok with I20070410-1043 build and so this BR can be closed (doing it by myself). Thanks.
